title: AI NEWS September 20 2025: The Pulse And The Pattern
summary: This AI news roundup for September 20, 2025, highlights key trends: sovereign data centers are gaining prominence, AI assistants are becoming practical teammates, and AI safety and regulation are increasingly important. Specific developments include the launch of Stargate UK for AI model development, advancements in ChatGPT's utility, and the introduction of GPT-5-Codex for software engineering. Huawei is also expanding its AI compute capabilities with new SuperPoDs and SuperClusters.

title: Anthropic Economic Index report: Uneven geographic and ...
summary: An Anthropic Economic Index report reveals that AI adoption is geographically uneven and varies across enterprises. The report found that AI usage correlates with income across countries, with higher adoption in wealthier nations and more diverse applications in leading countries. It also found that enterprise API usage is automation-dominant and that model capabilities matter more than cost in shaping business deployment.

title: Three Biggest AI Stories in September 2025
summary: I am sorry, but this article does not contain the three biggest AI stories in September 2025. It is a directory of articles from the Educational Technology and Change Journal.

title: Everyone's wondering if, and when, the AI bubble will pop. ...
summary: An article in Fortune magazine draws parallels between the current AI boom and the dot-com bubble of the late 1990s, noting massive investments based on potential rather than current profitability and infrastructure overinvestment. While major AI players are generating substantial income, the article questions whether current valuations and infrastructure investments can be justified by near-term returns, as many dot-com companies could not justify their valuations with actual business results. The piece cites rising interest rates and a recession in Japan as triggers for the dot-com crash, as well as flawed business models.

title: How AI and Other Technology Impacted Businesses ...
summary: According to the U.S. Census Bureau's 2023 Annual Business Survey, the adoption of new technologies like AI, robotics, and specialized software had little impact on the number or skills of workers employed by businesses between 2020 and 2022. When technologies did have an impact, most were more likely to increase worker numbers than decrease them, with the most common motivation for adopting cloud-based technology, specialized software, and AI being to improve the quality or reliability of processes or methods. Businesses used AI at a higher rate from 2021 to 2022 compared to other technologies, while cloud-based tech, specialized software, and specialized equipment were adopted more from 2016 to 2020.

title: Sport high−impact solution to keep people healthy, IOC ...
summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry addressed the UN General Assembly, highlighting sport as a cost-effective solution for preventing disease and promoting mental health. She also announced a deepened collaboration with the UN's Spotlight Initiative to combat violence against women and girls through sports-related programs. Coventry also met with heads of state, Olympic partners, and media representatives to discuss upcoming Olympic Games and related initiatives.

title: King's Hosts 2025 Regional Health and Human Performance ...
summary: King's College will host the 2025 Health and Human Performance Conference on October 3, 2025, at the Frank & Carolyn Kowalski Center in Wilkes-Barre, PA. The conference will feature sessions on injury prevention, exercise science, and leadership skills, and is open to sports science students and professionals. King's College's sports science programs offer opportunities to connect with a worldwide network of sports scientists.

title: Physical Activity | odphp.health.gov
summary: The Office of Disease Prevention and Health Promotion (ODPHP) provides resources and information promoting the importance of physical activity for all Americans, regardless of age or ability, to improve health and overall well-being. These resources include guidelines for healthy aging and support for older adults. ODPHP also celebrates National Physical Fitness and Sports Month each May.

title: Sporting faces off against Galaxy out in LA | Sept. 27, 2025
summary: Ahead of their Saturday night match against the LA Galaxy, Sporting Kansas City lists Erik Thommy as questionable with a groin injury, while Andrew Brody, Tim Leibold, and Manu Garcia are out due to injuries. The Galaxy will be without Isaiah Parente (suspended) and Riqui Puig (knee), with Marco Reus and Christian Ramirez listed as questionable.

title: Prevent Blindness Declares September as Sports Eye ...
summary: Prevent Blindness has declared September as Sports Eye Safety Month following new data showing over 43,300 sports-related eye injuries were treated in the U.S. in 2024, a 33% increase from the previous year, with basketball having the highest rate of injuries. The organization recommends athletes wear protective eye guards with polycarbonate lenses that meet sport-specific ASTM standards, while also offering free resources and information on sports eye safety.
